I have an explanation for this I think, using the one piece the center of mass is 'floating' in the middle/top of the cargo bay rather than on the cargo bay floor, with the multi-piece orbiter the CoM is on the same vertical plane as the floor of the cargo bay. This means that any changes in pitch during descent causes the center of lift to be too far below the center of mass causing the flipping motion when the atmosphere gets denser, but this is not noticeable during ascent due to the mass of the external tank.
